intro: Antholyza abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian antholyza, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and forest margins. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
